title: Geoff Wriglesworth
text:
Geoffrey "Geoff" W. Wriglesworth (born in September 1943) is an English former professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1960s and 1970s. He played at representative level for <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain</a>, and at club level for <a href="Heworth%20A.R.L.F.C.">Heworth A.R.L.F.C.</a> (of the <a href="National%20Conference%20League">National Conference League</a>, in <a href="Heworth%2C%20York">Heworth</a>, <a href="York">York</a>), <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds</a>, <a href="Bradford%20Bulls">Bradford Northern</a>, <a href="Hull%20Kingston%20Rovers">Hull Kingston Rovers</a>, <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Wakefield%20Trinity%20players">Heritage № 783</a>), and <a href="York%20Wasps">York</a>, as a , or , i.e. number 2 or 5, or, 3 or 4.
Background.
Geoff Wriglesworth's birth was registered in <a href="York">York</a>, <a href="Yorkshire">Yorkshire</a>.
Playing career.
County Cup Final appearances.
Geoff Wriglesworth played , i.e. number 5, in <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds</a>' 2-18 defeat by <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity</a> in the <a href="1964%20Yorkshire%20Cup">1964</a> <a href="RFL%20Yorkshire%20Cup">Yorkshire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1964%E2%80%9365%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1964–65 season</a> at <a href="Fartown%20Ground">Fartown Ground</a>, <a href="Huddersfield">Huddersfield</a> on Saturday 31 October 1964.
International honours.
Geoff Wriglesworth won <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a>s for <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain</a> while at Leeds in 1965 against New Zealand, and in 1966 against Australia (2 matches), and New Zealand (2 matches).
Club career.
Geoff Wriglesworth made his début for <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity</a> against <a href="Swinton%20Lions">Swinton</a> at <a href="Station%20Road%2C%20Swinton">Station Road, Swinton</a> on Monday 9 October 1972.
